semantic_title: Patient Admitted with Pressure Ulcer Evolving to Another Stage During Admission
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > a. Pressure ulcer stage codes > 6) Patient admitted with pressure ulcer evolving into another stage during the admission

content.full_text: If a patient is admitted to an inpatient hospital with a pressure ulcer at one stage and it progresses to a higher stage, two separate codes should be assigned: one code for the site and stage of the ulcer on admission and a second code for the same ulcer site and the highest stage reported during the stay. (Evidence: pg no: 59, L49-L53)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding pressure ulcers that progress to higher stages during inpatient admission, requiring dual coding (Evidence: pg no: 59, L49-L53)
key_concepts: Dual coding requirement for progressing ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52-L53)
Admission stage coding (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52)
Highest stage during stay coding (Evidence: pg no: 59, L53)
Inpatient hospital specific guideline (Evidence: pg no: 59, L51)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign two codes when pressure ulcer progresses to higher stage during admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52-L53)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a pressure ulcer progresses from one stage to a higher stage during inpatient stay, both the admission stage and highest stage during stay must be coded (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52-L53)

detailed_rules.rule_text: First code should reflect site and stage at admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52)
detailed_rules.explanation: One of the two required codes must represent the pressure ulcer's site and stage as documented at the time of admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L52)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Second code should reflect same site and highest stage during stay (Evidence: pg no: 59, L53)
detailed_rules.explanation: The second required code must represent the same ulcer site but with the highest stage reported during the entire inpatient stay (Evidence: pg no: 59, L53)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify pressure ulcer at admission with stage
Step 2: Monitor for stage progression during stay
Step 3: Identify highest stage reached during stay
Step 4: Assign code for admission stage
Step 5: Assign second code for highest stage during stay
